column4: When I use "Preferences -> Monitors" to activate and rotate my monitors, how can I find out what commands Gnome is using to do that?  It's xrandr I assume, but I need the full commands.
Read the source code. But the easy solution would be to read man xrandr for everything you'll need.
I know enough about xrandr, just want to cheat and use gnome's computed values, which are ideal.
actually I suppose `xrandr -q` shopuld give me everything I need after gnome sets things up, huh?
